text: Willy Otto Oskar Ley (October 2, 1906 â€“ June 24, 1969) was a German-American science writer and rocket scientist. He was a known supporter of cryptozoology. The crater Ley on the far side of the Moon is named in his honor. ==References== Category:1906 births Category:1969 deaths Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States Category:German historians Category:American historians Category:Writers from Berlin Category:Writers from New York City Category:Engineers from New York (state) Category:Scientists from New York City Category:German aerospace engineers
title: Willy Ley
